intro: Hieracium hilariense, commonly known as the Hilary's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium hilariense is often found in rocky or sandy areas and is adapted to thrive in relatively dry conditions.
